short_bio: Celebrity chef, restaurateur, and Jamie Oliver's mentor
method_of_cooking: Cook the spaghetti in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Meanwhile, in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and red pepper flakes and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the clams and white wine, cover, and simmer until the clams open, about 5 minutes. Discard any clams that do not open. Drain the spaghetti and add it to the skillet with the clams. Toss to combine, then sprinkle with parsley and serve.

ingredients_list: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
method_of_cooking: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Season the chicken pieces with salt and pepper. Dredge the chicken in the flour, shaking off any excess. In a large ovenproof pot or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chicken and cook until golden brown on all sides, about 10 minutes. Transfer the chicken to a plate. Add the onion and garlic to the pot and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the wine and cook until reduced by half, about 5 minutes. Add the tomatoes, oregano, red pepper flakes, and salt and black pepper to taste. Return the chicken to the pot and spoon the sauce over the chicken. Cover and bake until the chicken is cooked through, about 45 minutes. Serve hot.

ingredients_list: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
method_of_cooking: In a food processor, combine the basil, olive oil, Parmesan cheese, pine nuts, and garlic. Process until smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve over pasta, grilled meats, or vegetables.

ingredients_list: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
method_of_cooking: In a medium saucepan, heat the chicken broth over low heat. In a large saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the rice and stir to coat with the butter. Add the white wine and stir until it is absorbed. Add the saffron to the chicken broth and stir to combine. Add the broth to the rice, 1/2 cup at a time, stirring constantly and waiting for each addition to be absorbed before adding more. Cook until the rice is tender and creamy, about 20 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the Parmesan cheese. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

ingredients_list: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
method_of_cooking: Season the veal scallops with salt and pepper. Place a slice of prosciutto on each scallop, then top with 2 sage leaves. Secure with toothpicks. Dredge the scallops in flour, shaking off any excess. In a large skillet, heat the butter over medium heat. Add the scallops and cook until browned on both sides, about 4 minutes per side. Remove the scallops from the skillet and keep warm. Add the white wine to the skillet and cook until reduced by half, about 3 minutes. Pour the sauce over the scallops and serve hot.

1. Cook spaghetti in salted boiling water until al dente. 
2. In a pan, cook pancetta until crispy. 
3. Beat eggs in a bowl with grated pecorino romano cheese and black pepper. 
4. Drain spaghetti and add to the pan with pancetta, toss well. 
5. Remove from heat and add the egg and cheese mixture, stirring quickly until the eggs are cooked and the cheese has melted.

short_bio: Celebrity chef, restaurateur, and Iron Chef America star
method_of_cooking:
1. Preheat the oven to 220°C. 
2. Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface. 
3. In a bowl, crush the peeled tomatoes with a fork and mix with minced garlic, olive oil and salt. 
4. Spread the tomato sauce over the pizza dough, leaving a 1cm border around the edges. 
5. Sprinkle grated mozzarella cheese over the tomato sauce. 
6. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the crust is golden brown. 
7. Remove from the oven, sprinkle with fresh basil leaves and serve.

1. In a saucepan, bring the chicken broth to a simmer. 
2. In a large pan, melt the butter and sauté the chopped onion until translucent. 
3. Add the arborio rice to the pan and stir until it becomes slightly toasted. 
4. Add a ladleful of chicken broth to the rice and stir constantly until the broth is absorbed. 
5. Repeat the process of adding broth and stirring until the rice is cooked and creamy, for about 18-20 minutes. 
6. In a small bowl, dissolve the saffron threads in a ladleful of hot broth. 
7. Add the saffron and grated parmesan cheese to the risotto, stirring well. 
8. Serve hot with a sprinkle of grated parmesan cheese.

1. Preheat the oven to 180°C. 
2. In a large Dutch oven, heat olive oil over medium heat. 
3. Season veal shanks with salt and pepper and brown on all sides. 
4. Remove veal shanks from the pan and set aside. 
5. In the same pan, sauté chopped onion, carrots, celery and minced garlic until softened. 
6. Add the canned peeled tomatoes, white wine, chicken broth, bay leaf and rosemary sprig. 
7. Return the veal shanks to the pan and cover with the tomato mixture. 
8. Cover the pan with a lid and transfer it to the oven. 
9. Bake for 2-2 1/2 hours or until the veal shanks are tender and falling off the bone. 
10. Remove from the oven, discard the bay leaf and rosemary sprig. 
11. Serve hot with mashed potatoes or polenta.

short_bio: Celebrity chef, cookbook author, and television personality
method_of_cooking:
1. Preheat the oven to 180°C. 
2. Cook lasagna noodles according to package instructions, drain and set aside. 
3. In a pan, sauté ground beef, chopped onion and minced garlic until beef is browned. 
4. Add the can of crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, dried basil and dried oregano. 
5. Season with salt and pepper to taste, and simmer for 10-15 minutes. 
6. In a bowl, mix together the ricotta cheese, shredded mozzarella cheese and grated parmesan cheese. 
7. Spread a layer of meat sauce on the bottom of a baking dish. 
8. Place a layer of lasagna noodles on top of the sauce. 
9. Spread a layer of the cheese mixture on top of the noodles. 
10. Repeat layers of meat sauce, noodles and cheese mixture until all ingredients are used up. 
11. Cover the baking dish with foil and bake for 25 minutes. 
12. Remove the foil and bake for an additional 25 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly. 
13. Remove from the oven and let it rest for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

1. Slice the tomatoes and mozzarella cheese into 1/4 inch thick slices. 
2. Arrange the tomato and mozzarella slices on a platter, alternating them. 
3. Season with salt and pepper to taste.Drizzle extra-virgin olive oil over the top of the tomatoes and mozzarella. 
5. Garnish with fresh basil leaves. 
6. Serve immediately.

1. Cook bucatini pasta according to package instructions, drain and set aside. 
2. In a pan, sauté diced pancetta until crispy. 
3. Add chopped onion and minced garlic to the pan and cook until softened. 
4. Add the can of San Marzano tomatoes and red pepper flakes to the pan. 
5. Season with salt and pepper to taste, and simmer for 15-20 minutes. 
6. Toss the cooked bucatini with the sauce. 
7. Top with grated pecorino cheese. 
8. Serve hot.

1. Preheat the oven to 180°C. 
2. In a large Dutch oven, heat olive oil over medium heat. 
3. Season veal shanks with salt and pepper and brown on all sides. 
4. Remove veal shanks from the pan and set aside. 
5. In the same pan, sauté chopped onion, carrots, celery and minced garlic until softened. 
6. Add the canned peeled tomatoes, white wine, chicken broth, bay leaf and rosemary sprig. 
7. Return the veal shanks to the pan and cover with the tomato mixture. 
8. Cover the pan with a lid and transfer it to the oven. 
9. Bake for 2-2 1/2 hours or until the veal shanks are tender and falling off the bone. 
10. In a small bowl, mix together butter, lemon zest and chopped parsley. 
11. Remove from the oven, discard the bay leaf and rosemary sprig. 
12. Serve the veal shanks hot, topped with the butter mixture.
